title: Textile, 1900–60
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: tabby, tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave
description: Large-scale horizontal pattern of stylized dancers, in polychrome on bright orange ground, with central portion showing geometric motifs on purple ground. Both panels have one selvedge and one sewed edge. Possibly warp-printed, machine woven "yard-goods". The two were once sewed together to make a sari.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1900–60.Medium: cotton
Technique: tabby, tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave. 1960-5-3-a,b.
